skill.name: simpy
skill.description: Process-based discrete-event simulation framework in Python. Use this skill when building simulations of systems with processes, queues, resources, and time-based events such as manufacturing systems, service operations, network traffic, logistics, or any system where entities interact with shared resources over time.

skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and utility skill for SimPy simulation framework. Contains Python scripts for monitoring and templating. Filesystem access limited to user-specified CSV export paths for simulation data output.

content.value_statement: Complex systems with queues and shared resources are difficult to analyze without simulation. SimPy provides a Python-based framework for modeling processes, resources, and time-based events to predict system behavior before implementation.
actual_capabilities: Model processes as Python generator functions with yield-based event handling
Create shared resources with configurable capacity for servers, machines, and containers
Implement event-driven scheduling using timeouts, signals, and process synchronization
Monitor simulation data with statistics collection and CSV export
Build real-time simulations synchronized with wall-clock time
limitations: Runs in simulation time only, not real physical time unless using RealtimeEnvironment
Does not connect to external data sources or physical hardware
Cannot perform continuous simulation with fixed time steps
Requires Python 3.7+ and SimPy package installation

use_cases.title: Capacity Planning
use_cases.description: Model manufacturing lines, call centers, or server farms to determine optimal resource allocation before investment.

use_cases.title: Process Analysis
use_cases.description: Simulate healthcare patient flows, logistics networks, or traffic systems to evaluate improvement strategies.

use_cases.title: Queue Simulation
use_cases.description: Test algorithm behavior under load by modeling request queues, worker pools, and concurrent processing patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Simulation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a SimPy simulation with a resource that has capacity 2. Model customer arrivals every 1-3 time units using exponential distribution. Each customer uses the resource for 2-5 time units. Run for 100 time units and report average wait time.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Resource
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a producer-consumer simulation using SimPy Store. Producers create items every 2 time units and add to a store with capacity 10. Consumers retrieve items every 3 time units. Track item counts over time.

prompt_templates.title: Priority Queue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simulation with PriorityResource where high-priority requests (priority 1) can preempt low-priority requests (priority 10). Show how preemption works with a practical example.

prompt_templates.title: Real-Time
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a RealtimeEnvironment with factor=1.0. Create a control loop that reads a simulated sensor every 0.5 seconds and logs values. Demonstrate real-time synchronization.

output_examples.input: Create a SimPy simulation of a coffee shop with 2 baristas serving customers. Customers arrive every 2-6 minutes. Service time is 3-8 minutes. Run for 60 minutes and report utilization and average wait time.

best_practices: Set random.seed() for reproducible simulation results across runs
Use context managers (with resource.request()) for automatic resource cleanup
Collect monitoring data throughout simulation rather than only at the end
Start with simple models and validate against analytical solutions before adding complexity
anti_patterns: Forgetting yield statements in process functions, causing infinite loops
Reusing events that can only be triggered once instead of creating new events
Mixing simulation time units inconsistently throughout the model
Running simulations without monitoring to track performance metrics

faq.question: What Python version is required?
faq.answer: SimPy requires Python 3.7 or later. Install with pip install simpy.

faq.question: What simulation types can I model?
faq.answer: SimPy handles discrete-event systems where events occur at irregular intervals. It is not suitable for continuous simulations with fixed time steps.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my existing code?
faq.answer: Yes. SimPy scripts integrate with any Python code. Import your business logic into process functions and call external functions during timeouts.

faq.question: Is my simulation data safe?
faq.answer: Data stays on your machine. CSV exports write only to paths you specify. No network calls or external data transmission occurs.

faq.question: Why are my results different each run?
faq.answer: Stochastic simulations use random numbers. Set random.seed(fixed_value) at the start of your script for reproducible results.

faq.question: How does SimPy compare to other tools?
faq.answer: SimPy uses Python instead of domain-specific languages. It integrates with data science tools and is ideal for researchers comfortable with Python.
